marketNews.title: Perbaikan ARPU Segmen 'Mobile' Topang Pendapatan pada 3Q25
marketNews.content: Operationally, the mobile segment remains the main contributor with revenues of 59 trillion rupiah during 9M25 (-6% YoY). Although annually declining, mobile segment revenue showed quarterly improvement in 3Q25 (-2% YoY, +5% QoQ) along with the growth of average revenue per user (ARPU) to 43,400 rupiah (+0.7% YoY, +5.3% QoQ), marking the first quarterly growth and the highest level throughout 2025. This ARPU increase was followed by a relatively stable subscriber base at 157.5 million (-0.5% YoY, -0.6% QoQ), indicating that price competition in the industry is starting to improve. Meanwhile, the consumer segment revenue during 9M25 increased slightly by +1% YoY to 19.7 trillion rupiah. Quarterly, the consumer segment revenue weakened in 3Q25 (-2% YoY, -2% QoQ) due to a drop in IndiHome ARPU to 209,800 rupiah (-10.6% YoY, -3.3% QoQ), marking the lowest level since 2024. Management explained this weakening was caused by a shift in customer preference from triple play (3P) packages to internet-only (1P) as well as expansion into non-Java areas with lower purchasing power. Revenue performance from other business segments was also pressured in 3Q25 - namely, the enterprise segment (-3% YoY, -3% QoQ) and wholesales and international business (+8% YoY, -8% QoQ) - which contributed to TLKM's relatively flat revenue in 3Q25 (-1% YoY, +1% QoQ). Looking at the 9M25 revenue realization which reached only 73% of the consensus 2025F estimate at 149.6 trillion rupiah (vs. 9M24: 75% annual realization), we assess that this consensus estimate remains achievable, considering there are several positive catalysts for TLKM's performance, one of which is the increase in mobile segment ARPU followed by a stable subscriber base.

marketNews.title: Outlook: Fiber Asset Spin-off and Subsidiary Streamlining
marketNews.content: TLKM management explained that the spin-off of the company's fiber assets to its subsidiary, PT Telkom Infrastruktur Indonesia (TIF), will take place in 2 stages. The first stage covers 56% of the company's fiber assets, expected to be completed after the GMER on December 12, 2025, while phase 2 covers the remaining 44% of fiber assets to be carried out in 1H26, followed by opening opportunities for strategic partnerships in 2H26. TLKM management explained that this spin-off is an effort to change the company's position from an operational holding to a pure strategic holding, which is expected to improve operational efficiency while opening strategic partnership opportunities for TIF in the future. TLKM management will also continue to simplify subsidiaries as part of the value-unlocking dividend agenda. Management explained that the company will announce by the end of 2025 which subsidiaries will be merged and/or liquidated.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: TLKM's performance in 9M25 remains under pressure, mainly stemming from the weakening mobile segment revenue (-6% YoY). However, performance in 3Q25 is beginning to show indications of ARPU recovery in the industry, where TLKM management is optimistic this momentum can continue into the next quarter and become a positive catalyst for performance improvement in 4Q25. In addition, the ongoing restructuring initiatives for fiber assets and subsidiary streamlining can provide positive signals and a foundation for future performance recovery.

marketNews.title: When Belief Becomes a Trap in the Stock Market
marketNews.content: "There are many examples of stocks like that, right? There will be many stocks like that later." - ricky2212

tickerNews.title: Telkom Indonesia (TLKM) Reports IDR 4.8 Trillion Net Profit in 3Q25 (-19% YoY, -7% QoQ); 9M25 Net Profit at IDR 15.7 Trillion (-11% YoY), Below Expectation
tickerNews.content: Telkom Indonesia (TLKM) recorded a net profit of 4.8 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (-19% YoY, -7% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 15.7 trillion rupiah (-11% YoY), below expectations as it equals 68% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. 9M24: 75% realization for 2024). Operating profit during 9M25 decreased by -9% YoY as operating profit margin shrank to 26.7% (vs. 9M24: 28.9%) due to a decline in revenue (-2% YoY) amid an increase in cost of revenue (+3% YoY), although opex decreased by -6% YoY. Following the weak performance in 9M25, TLKM management revised down the 2025 revenue guidance from flat to slightly contracting. This marks the second downward revision of the 2025 revenue guidance, after management revised the revenue guidance from low single-digit growth to flat in 1H25. We assess the consensus revenue estimate of 149.6 trillion rupiah for 2025F, based on 9M25 realization of only 73% (vs. 9M24: 75% annual realization), to still be achievable, considering positive catalysts such as the increase in mobile segment ARPU accompanied by a stable subscriber base.

tickerNews.title: ASII: 9M25 Net Profit (-5% YoY) In Line with Expectations, Announces Buyback up to IDR 2 Trillion
tickerNews.content: ASII: Astra International recorded a net profit of 8.96 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (-10% YoY, +4% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 24.5 trillion rupiah (-5% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 76% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. 9M24: 76% realization for 2024). The decline in net profit during 9M25 was caused by the weakening performance of the 'heavy equipment, mining, and energy' segment under its subsidiary United Tractors (UNTR), which experienced a net profit decline of -26% YoY. Meanwhile, its other main segments, 'automotive & mobility' and 'financial services,' booked net profit increases of +1% YoY and +8% YoY, respectively, during 9M25. The 'agribusiness' segment became the segment with the highest net profit growth at +34% YoY. In a separate information disclosure, ASII announced a share buyback plan with a fund allocation of up to 2 trillion rupiah in the period of November 3, 2025-January 30, 2026.

tickerNews.title: United Tractors (UNTR) 9M25 Net Profit at IDR 11.5 Trillion (-26% YoY), Below Expectation; Announces Buyback up to IDR 2 Trillion
tickerNews.content: UNTR: United Tractors recorded a net profit of 3.3 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (-32% QoQ, -45% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 11.5 trillion rupiah (-26% YoY), below expectations as it equals 68% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. 2-year average: 77% annual realization). UNTR's performance in 3Q25 was pressured by weak Profit Before Tax (PBT) in the 'construction machinery' and 'gold & other minerals' segments, which fell by -37% QoQ and -45% QoQ, respectively. In 3Q25, Komatsu heavy equipment sales volume decreased to 925 units (-31% QoQ, -21% YoY) - marking the lowest level since 1Q24 - following the completion of carry-over from last year's sales. Meanwhile, the 'mining contractor' segment was the only segment recording quarterly PBT growth in 3Q25 (+48% QoQ). On the other hand, a forex loss of 353 billion rupiah in 3Q25 also pressured the net profit margin down to 10.5% (vs. 2Q25: 14.4%, 3Q24: 17.3%). In a separate information disclosure, UNTR announced a share buyback plan with a fund allocation of up to 2 trillion rupiah in the period from October 31, 2025, to January 30, 2026.

tickerNews.title: Gudang Garam (GGRM) 9M25 Net Profit Reaches IDR 1.1 Trillion (+12% YoY), Highest Quarterly Net Profit Since 4Q23 in 3Q25
tickerNews.content: GGRM: Gudang Garam recorded a net profit of 990 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25: 13 billion rupiah, 3Q24: 67 billion rupiah), marking the highest quarterly net profit since 4Q23. This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 1.1 trillion rupiah (+12% YoY). Revenue after excise tax increased by +15% YoY/+3% YoY in 3Q25/9M25, although gross revenue decreased by -4% YoY/-9% YoY. Based on the latest data from GGRM in 1H25, there was an increase in blended average selling price by +4% YoY, while sales volume decreased by -15% YoY. On the other hand, efficiency in selling expenses in 3Q25/9M25 (-45% YoY/-27% YoY) pushed the operating profit margin up to 6% in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25: 0.9%, 3Q24: 0.9%) and 2.8% during 9M25 (vs. 9M24: 2.5%).

tickerNews.title: Trimegah Bangun Persada (NCKL) 9M25 Net Profit at IDR 6.4 Trillion (+33% YoY), Exceeds Expectations; Gross and Operating Margins Decline in 3Q25 QoQ
tickerNews.content: NCKL: Trimegah Bangun Persada recorded a net profit of 2.3 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (-4% QoQ, +15% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 6.4 trillion rupiah (+33% YoY), exceeding expectations as it equals 79% of the consensus 2025F estimate. Quarterly, operating profit decreased by -2% QoQ in 3Q25 due to a decline in gross profit margin and operating profit margin to 31.7% (vs. 2Q25: 37.9%) and 27.9% (vs. 2Q25: 33.9%) respectively, along with an increase in cost of revenue (+31% QoQ) that was higher than revenue (+19% QoQ). The quarterly increase in the cost of revenue was influenced by a negative inventory movement effect of 832 billion rupiah (vs. 2Q25: positive 794 billion rupiah) and an increase in royalty expense to 449 billion rupiah (+35% QoQ). Furthermore, profit from associates decreased by -30% QoQ in 3Q25 to 867 billion rupiah, mainly due to a decrease in the share of profit from PT Halmahera Persada Lygend (-51% QoQ) and PT Karunia Permai Sentosa (-69% QoQ), but this was compensated by an exchange gain of 21 billion rupiah (vs. 2Q25: a loss of 253 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: Sumber Alfaria Trijaya (AMRT) 9M25 Net Profit at IDR 2.3 Trillion (-3% YoY), Slightly Below Expectation; 3Q25 Operating Profit Contracts -25% YoY
tickerNews.content: AMRT: Sumber Alfaria Trijaya recorded a net profit of 431 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (-29% YoY, -53% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 2.3 trillion rupiah (-3% YoY), slightly below expectations as it equals 66% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. 2-year average: 70% annual realization). Despite still recording revenue growth of +6% YoY in 3Q25, AMRT's performance was pressured by a shrinking gross profit margin to 20.6% (vs. 3Q24: 21%, 2Q25: 22%). Net profit was further pressured by an increase in opex (+8% YoY), mainly from salary expenses (+11% YoY). This caused 3Q25 operating profit to contract by -25% YoY, so operating profit during 9M25 contracted by -5% YoY (vs. 1H25: +2% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS) 3Q25 Net Profit at USD 93 Million (+22% YoY, +13% QoQ); 9M25 Net Profit at USD 238 Million (-10% YoY), In Line
tickerNews.content: PGAS: Perusahaan Gas Negara recorded a net profit of 93 million US dollars in 3Q25 (+22% YoY, +13% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 238 million US dollars (-10% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 73% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. 2-year average: 74% annual realization). The growth in net profit in 3Q25 was mainly driven by: 1) revenue growth (+1% YoY, +1% QoQ); and 2) expansion of the operating profit margin to 14.4% (vs. 2Q25: 14%, 3Q24: 13.1%) along with a decrease in general and administrative expenses (-21% YoY, -4% QoQ). As of 9M25, PGAS recorded gas sales volume of 833 BBtud (-2% YoY), gas transmission volume reached 1,622 MMSCFD (+6% YoY), and upstream sales volume reached 16,892 BOEPD (-16% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Sido Muncul (SIDO) 9M25 Net Profit at IDR 819 Billion (+5% YoY), Exceeds Expectations; Announces Interim Dividend of IDR 22/Share
tickerNews.content: SIDO: Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul recorded a net profit of 218 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+29% YoY, -41% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 819 billion rupiah (+5% YoY), exceeding expectations as it equals 69% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. 3-year average: 65% annual realization). The growth in net profit in 3Q25 was mainly driven by revenue recovery (+23% YoY), continuing the trend from the previous quarter (vs. 2Q25: +23% YoY, 1Q25: -25% YoY). This resulted in 9M25 revenue growing by +4% YoY (vs. 1H25: -1% YoY), slightly below management's 2025 guidance of +5% YoY. The gross profit margin in 3Q25 was recorded at 56.2% (vs. 2Q25: 60.5%, 1Q25: 52.3%). Meanwhile, opex in 3Q25 grew by +41% YoY and +32% QoQ, so operating profit in 3Q25 increased annually (+24% YoY, -40% QoQ). SIDO also announced it will distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year of 22 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of ~3.9% as of Friday (31/10), with the cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiation market on November 10, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Bukit Asam (PTBA) 3Q25 Net Profit at IDR 561 Billion (+27% QoQ, -53% YoY); 9M25 Net Profit Only IDR 1.4 Trillion (-57% YoY), Below Expectation
tickerNews.content: PTBA: Bukit Asam recorded a net profit of 561 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+27% QoQ, -53% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to only 1.4 trillion rupiah (-57% YoY), below expectations as it equals 43% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. 9M24: 63% realization for 2024). The quarterly net profit growth in 3Q25 was driven by an expansion of the gross profit margin to 12.1% (+69 bps QoQ), which was influenced by inventory movement effects. From the top-line side, revenue in 3Q25 grew by +4% QoQ along with sales volume growth (+7% QoQ) which compensated for the decline in average selling price (-3% QoQ). Meanwhile, the decline in net profit performance during 9M25 was pressured by an increase in cash cost (+3% YoY) amid a decrease in average selling price (-6% YoY), causing the gross profit margin to drop to 11.4% (-691 bps YoY). Revenue during 9M25 grew by +2% YoY, in line with expectations as it equals 73% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. 9M24: 72% annual realization).

tickerNews.title: Crude Palm Oil Futures for January 2026 Contract Fall to Lowest Since Early August 2025; Global Production Forecasts Driving Weakness
tickerNews.content: The CPO forward price for the January 2026 contract fell by about -1.29% to 4,205 ringgit per ton on Friday (31/10), marking the lowest level since early August 2025. Bloomberg reported that the weakening of palm oil prices was driven by the prospect of increased global production in 2026. Market analysis firm BMI projects that global palm oil production is expected to increase by +1.8% YoY to 80.1 million tons in 2026, with Indonesian production expected to rise by +3.3% YoY to 47.5 million tons while Malaysian production is expected to increase by +0.5% YoY to 19.5 million tons. BMI also projects that Malaysian palm oil stocks are likely to remain high until 1Q26.

tickerNews.title: Bank OCBC NISP (NISP) 3Q25 Net Profit at IDR 1.3 Trillion (-12% YoY, -1% QoQ); 9M25 Net Profit Flat at IDR 3.8 Trillion; Loan Growth Slows to +2% YoY; LDR Drops to 71%
tickerNews.content: Bank OCBC NISP (NISP) recorded a net profit of 1.3 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (-12% YoY, -1% QoQ), resulting in a flat net profit of 3.8 trillion rupiah for 9M25. Net profit was pressured by a -99% YoY decline in Non-Operating Income in 3Q25/9M25. The decline in net profit during 9M25 was influenced by the high-base effect in 2Q24 which recorded an acquisition gain of PT Bank Commonwealth of 331 billion rupiah. Excluding the acquisition impact, net profit still grew by +10% YoY in 9M25. Operationally, PPOP increased by +21% YoY/+22% YoY in 3Q25/9M25, although the Net Interest Margin fell to 3.8% in 3Q25 (vs. 3Q24: 4.4%) - marking the third consecutive quarterly decline in NIM. Meanwhile, financing growth slowed to +2% YoY as of September 2025 (vs. September 2024: +12% YoY), amid an increase in Third Party Funds (TPF) of +15% YoY, causing the Loan-to-Deposit Ratio to drop to 71% - the lowest level since at least 2023.

tickerNews.title: Triputra Agro Persada (TAPG) Plans to Distribute 2nd Interim Dividend for FY2025 of IDR 50/Share (~2.7% Yield)
tickerNews.content: Triputra Agro Persada (TAPG) plans to distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year of approximately 992.6 billion rupiah or 50 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of ~2.7% as of Friday (31/10). The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiation market is November 10, 2025, while payment will be on November 28, 2025. This is the 2nd interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year from TAPG, following the interim dividend distribution of 39 rupiah per share in August 2025.

tickerNews.title: Impack Pratama Industri (IMPC) Controller Sells 500 Million Shares for IDR 1 Trillion to Increase Free Float
tickerNews.content: The controller of Impack Pratama Industri (IMPC), PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa, sold 500 million IMPC shares at an average price of 2,000 rupiah per share on October 30, 2025. The total transaction value reached 1 trillion rupiah and was aimed at realizing investments and increasing free float. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa in IMPC decreased from 42.14% to 41.22%.

tickerNews.title: Chandra Daya Investasi (CDIA) 9M25 Net Profit Soars +266% YoY to USD 78 Million, Driven by Fair Value Change in Investments
tickerNews.content: Chandra Daya Investasi (CDIA) recorded a net profit of 78 million US dollars during 9M25 (+266% YoY), driven by a gain on the fair value change of investments amounting to 46.1 million US dollars (vs. 9M24: none). CDIA's other financial assets consist of a 4.99% investment in Raharja Energi Cepu (RATU) and several other investments. Operationally, operating profit was recorded at 15.2 million US dollars in 9M25 (vs. 9M24: 1.5 million US dollars) along with revenue growth (+42% YoY) which was higher than the cost of revenue (+22% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Kimia Farma (KAEF) Plans to Sell 38 Land and Building Assets Valued at IDR 2.1 Trillion; Sale via Auction and Transfer to Affiliate
tickerNews.content: Kimia Farma (KAEF) plans to sell 38 assets consisting of land and buildings with a total asset value of 2.1 trillion rupiah, based on book value as of June 30, 2025. This transaction is intended to support the company's sustainability, debt repayment, and working capital. The divestment of land and building assets at 37 locations with a total book value of 1.8 trillion rupiah will be carried out through a public offering scheme (auction) via the State Property and Auction Service Office, while 1 asset in Cikarang with a book value of 347 billion rupiah will be transferred to an affiliate party, namely PT Bio Farma. This plan will be discussed in the GMER on November 3, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Wijaya Karya (WIKA) Bondholders Approve Restructuring for 2020 Series A, 2020 Series B, and 2022 Series A Bonds; Maturity Extended to 2027
tickerNews.content: Wijaya Karya (WIKA) obtained approval from bondholders to restructure the Stage I 2020 Series A bonds, Stage I 2020 Series B bonds, and Stage I 2022 Series A bonds. In this approval, the maturity date for the Stage I 2020 Series A bonds and Stage I 2020 Series B bonds is postponed from December 18, 2025, to December 18, 2027, while the maturity date for the Stage I 2022 Series A bonds is postponed from November 3, 2025, to November 3, 2027. The interest rate for each bond remains unchanged. WIKA also has the full right to make early redemption of all or part of these bonds through a buy option to the bondholders.
